intro: Anemia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed anemone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its showy, radially symmetrical flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features palmate leaves with finely toothed margins, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Anemia denticulata is valued for its early spring blooms and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual interest.
